title: How to write a bibliography of four different resources used to conduct research - Quora

response.answer_text: You will need to spend some time gathering information. Dates, facts, names of researchers, authors, and scientists involved. These will need to be ordered carefully to fit the pieces of work you have. Keep in mind the reason for a bibliography and ensure that it is possible for someone who is reading the resource to be able to track down any point which has been made to see where it comes from. Bearing this in mind, you will need to clearly date each fact of note, each important point which is being made, and it’s origin so everything may be traced…time date name of paper/article and author. Your lists of information must be alphabetical and numbered to match numbers in the text of the resource to which they pertain., or they could be in numerical order of the numbers in the text. You may need to cross reference where there are more than one reference in the text for the same author or fact etc. Whatever means you choose to use, the important thing is that any reader of the text should be able to easily find the fact, quotation, evidence, or author etc, by means of a number in the text which links it with the bibliography, or if not a number then by the authors name alphabetically in the bibliography. Some scientific books have both, list of the quotations in the text by number and another list of authors alphabetically ordered with cross referencing linking each list.
